title: Compiler crashes during borrow checking.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
struct Data<'a> {
    data: [u8; Self::SIZE],
}

impl<'a> Data<'a> {
    const SIZE: usize = 12;
}
```

```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir/borrow_check/nll/universal_regions.rs:741: cannot convert `ReEarlyBound(0, 'a)` to a region vid

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.39.0-nightly (eceec57f7 2019-09-18) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [mir_borrowck] processing `Data::data::{{constant}}#0`

error: aborting due to previous error

error: Could not compile `playground`.

```

Crashes on stable and nightly.
